componentInstanceProperties.name: IntroText
componentInstanceProperties.value: Dive into a wealth of knowledge

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: What to know before you invest

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Retail Investor

Most investors are Retail investors and usually invest in Crowd-Source Funding (CSF) offers via VentureCrowd.  The minimum requirements to be regarded as a retail investor is: Be over the age of 18 years of age. Maximum amount of $10,000 worth of investments in any one single offer/company, per investing entity, in any 12 month period.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Wholesale Investor

An investor must meet the legislative requirements ASIC sets to undertake an investment in a wholesale offer. The Corporations Regulations prescribe the asset and income criteria that must be met before you can be issued a wholesale investor certificate. A person is only eligible to be the subject of a certificate if they have the following: A gross income of $250,000 or more per annum in each of the previous two years or; Net assets of at least $2.5 million (reg 6D.2.03 and reg 7.1.28) If you believe you are a wholesale investor, please get a qualified accountant to issue you a wholesale certificate. Once you have this, please email hello@venturecrowd.com.au to be in contact with one of our team members, who will walk you through the next steps of the registration.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Context
componentInstanceProperties.value: If you are participating in a Wholesale offer, CSF offer or direct listing, there are different ways to invest that depend on the accreditation you hold.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is the difference between a wholesale investor and retail investor?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is the difference between a wholesale investor and retail investor?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Please see this link for information on wholesale investor requirements on the ASIC website HERE. Investors can qualify as a wholesale / sophisticated or experienced investor as follows:

1. Via confirmation of income or assets

Your accountant can provide this certificate for you if you meet the criteria of an Income of $250,000 GROSS per annum for the last 2 consecutive years and/or $2.5M in NET assets.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
2. Via confirmation of your investing experience

If you are an experienced investor with multiple investments in venture capital, shares or property, you may be qualified by our team as a wholesale investor after discussing your experience and submitting an application known as an EIC (Experienced Investor Certificate). An EIC enables you to invest in relevant wholesale offers.
  • Experience in Property > EIC for Property > Enables you to invest in any wholesale property offers (does not cover investing in start-ups.)
  • Experience in VC, shares and the like > EIC for Start-ups > Enables you to invest in any VC start-up offers (does not cover investing in property.)

    • 3. By investing $500k in one of VentureCrowd's investment offers

    If you make an investment of $500,000 or more into one of our investment opportunities you qualify as wholesale for that investment only.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: So how do you register as a wholesale investor with VentureCrowd?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: So how do you register as a wholesale investor with VentureCrowd?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
VentureCrowd offers both retail and wholesale offers to investors. Offers are identified by the individual Tile heading Retail or Wholesale on this page HERE.

  • Wholesale Investment Opportunities are open to wholesale, sophisticated and experienced investors. Investors must meet the criteria under Wholesale/Sophisticated Certification or EIC (Experienced Investor Certification).

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value: • Retail Investment Opportunities offers are open to every person over the age of 18 years - no wholesale certification is required for a Retail Investment. There is a maximum investment amount for Retail investors of $10,000 per company, per entity, per 12 month period. Higher investment amounts in a Retail offer do require wholesale certification. Retail offers are shown under an EOI (Expression of Interest) on the VentureCrowd website for a number of weeks prior to launching. Be sure to complete your details on the EOI page to be kept up to date on the offer launch. If there is not enough interest, the offer may not launch. Once launched, the deal page is updated with more information and the Offer Documents made available.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is the difference between a wholesale deal and a retail deal?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is the difference between a wholesale deal and a retail deal?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
We need to carry out an Anti-Money Laundering (AML) check on all our investors to verify identity. This check doesn’t affect your credit score. In most cases these checks will be completed in the background using electoral data. 

However, if you are making your first investment through VentureCrowd we require 2 forms of identification a copy of two documents, one to confirm your identity and one to confirm your address.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Once your identity has been verified we will contact you once a year to re-confirm documents

What if I can’t supply acceptable documentation?

If we are unable to verify your identity as an investor, we won’t be able to process your investment and it will be cancelled as a result.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: Why do you need to verify my identity?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: Why do you need to verify my identity?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value: Equity crowdfunding is an alternative way for startups to raise capital. Unlike traditional crowdfunding on platforms like Kickstarter and GoFundMe, where you typically raise money in small amounts from many people in exchange for rewards or to collect donations, equity crowdfunding allows you to raise larger amounts of money by selling shares in your company to a group of investors. Equity crowdfunding is securities-based and therefore highly regulated in Australia and, indeed, internationally. It is a legitimate way to raise capital in many countries, including the US, UK and Australia.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
How does equity crowdfunding work?

Equity crowdfunding campaigns are run on online platforms where businesses create profiles that include their pitches, financial statements, and other information. Investors browse through these profiles and decide whether to invest in a particular business. In return for their investment, investors receive equity ownership in the business.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Context
componentInstanceProperties.value: If you are participating in a Wholesale offer, CSF offer or direct listing, there are different ways to invest that depend on the accreditation you hold.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
VentureCrowd's due diligence process is a comprehensive evaluation designed to ensure that only high-potential and impactful companies are listed on their platform. The process involves several key steps:

1. Venture Evaluation:

This initial phase assesses various aspects of the company, including its business model, market opportunity, technology, uniqueness, disruption potential, and the strength of its team. The evaluation also considers the company's market needs, problem-solving capabilities, sustainability, and overall compatibility with VentureCrowd's mission.

2. Due Diligence Requirements:

Once a company passes the evaluation, it must meet specific due diligence criteria before being accepted for a crowdfunding campaign. This includes:
  • Corporate Documentation: Ensuring all necessary legal and corporate documents are in place.
  • Intellectual Property: Verifying ownership, development, and management of the company's IP.
  • Material Contracts: Reviewing contracts with key customers, partners, and suppliers to assess stability and risk.
  • The Team: Evaluating the experience and capability of the company's team, particularly in the early stages of growth.
  • Financials and Capital Strategy: Analyzing the company’s financial health, capital management, and growth strategy.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
3. Runway Requirement

VentureCrowd requires that companies have a runway of at least six months, as the due diligence and campaign process typically takes 2 to 3 months.

This structured due diligence process not only helps to mitigate risks for investors but also increases the likelihood of achieving returns by selecting companies with strong growth potential and alignment with ESG goals.

Where can I access the investment due diligence documents?

Full disclosure and due diligence documents for each opportunity are available on the VentureCrowd website, listed under the specific deal. You will be required to complete identity verification via the platform to access sensitive documents.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is VentureCrowds equity crowdfunding due diligence process?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is VentureCrowds equity crowdfunding due diligence process?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value: How is it that when startups raise capital with VentureCrowd, they add just one line to their capital tables? They can do this because of VentureCrowd’s nominee structure, a crowdfunding essential for startups with many benefits for businesses and investors. But how does this work when so many people invest? And why does it even matter? To help you understand how it works and why the nominee structure is so important, we’ve provided a separate Q&A about nominee structures here.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is a nominee structure and why does it matter?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is a nominee structure and why does it matter?

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: How to invest with VentureCrowd

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
You can choose from a variety of payment methods that suits your preference. Depending on where you are located, you have different payment methods available to you.
  • Direct Debit: This payment method allows you to pay directly from your bank account. You will need to provide your bank details and authorise VentureCrowd to debit the amount of your investment from your account.
  • Bank Transfer: This method allows you to make the payment to a unique BSB and account number that's assigned to your VentureCrowd account, or use a new one and save the details to your account.
  • PayID: This is a fast and simple way to pay by sending the funds to VentureCrowds PayID email address and your unique reference number.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The below methods are processed through our secure payment gateway checkout:
  • Google Pay: This payment method allows you to make fast and secure payments using your Google Pay account. You can link your bank account, debit, or credit card to Google Pay, and complete the transaction with just a few taps on your device.
  • Apple Pay: If you are an Apple user, Apple Pay provides a convenient and secure way to pay for your investment. By linking your Apple Wallet to your bank account or card, you can authorise payments using Face ID, Touch ID, or your device passcode.
  • Debit Card: You can also pay using your debit card using our secure . Simply enter your card details the payment will be processed in a matter of seconds. This method ensures the funds are instantly deducted from your account, offering a seamless payment experience.


    • Unsupported Payment Methods

    We currently do not accept Cheque, Credit Card or Cash.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: What payments method can I use?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: What payments method can I use?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value: Currently, you can only invest within Australia using $AUD (Australian dollars).

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: I'm not in Australia. Can I invest from overseas?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: I'm not in Australia. Can I invest from overseas?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Most of the investment offers listed on VentureCrowd will compose of two distinct phases starting with an #1 EOI phase and followed by an #2 Investment phase.

#1 EOI Phase

An EOI allows you to review the initial information provided and assess your interest in the offer. If you are interested to learn more about the offer and keep up to date with when it launches, always register your EOI. More information is in the form of email updates leading up to the launch of the offer, and Key Document/s provided once the offer launches #2 The Investment stage. A completed EOI does not create an investment obligation or contract/binding agreement in any manner. This comes in #2 Investment Phase. An EOI also provides you with peace of mind and unique investment opportunities before they open up to the greater market. Your EOI gives you an exclusive first bite of the investment apple. Registering your EOI can be particularly important for deals that will reach their maximum target quickly, as, once the offer is open, investors will secure their allocation on a first come first served basis. Once the offer's maximum target is reached, or they are ‘fully funded”, no more applications to invest will be accepted. If you haven’t already invested, you will miss out. Communication will be via email, so keep an eye on your inbox as well as the VentureCrowd website. If you don't want to miss out, make sure you express your interest!

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
#2 Investment Phase

The investment phase is where you make an application and actually transfer funds. You do not need to complete an EOI to invest in a new offer through VentureCrowd, but it does mean you will be notified first. It is easy to know if you have made an application and completed your investment by logging into your profile and making sure there is a pending application ready to be paid. An investment can be undertaken at any point in the investment phase while still open. Due Diligence will be undertaken on investors to qualify that the minimum requirements are met (where needed). A unitholder or shareholder certificate is issued to investors up to 28 days after the deal closes (not when you initially make your investment), confirming the transaction. During this period your investment will still stay pending.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is the difference between an EOI and an investment

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: What is the difference between an EOI and an investment

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value: You can request to cancel and investment while it is still pending before the cooling off period has expired. To do this, go to the ‘My Portfolio’ section of the portal, navigate to ‘Pending’, find the opportunity you invested in and click on the investments. In the investment details page, click on ‘Investment support’ in the top right corner. Select ‘Request a refund’ and select the reason that applies to you and submit by clicking ‘Submit refund’.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: How can I cancel an investment?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: How can I cancel an investment?

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value: What to expect once you invest

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Once your payment has been made, you will receive a receipt via email. Below are the expected processing times for payment methods:
  • BPay: Your payment will be processed within 2-3 business days.
  • PayID: Your payment will be processed instantly.
  • Bank Transfer: Your payment will be processed within 1-3 business days.
  • Google Pay: Your payment will be processed instantly.
  • Apple Pay: Your payment will be processed instantly.
  • Direct Debit: Your payment will be processed instantly.


    • Once the investment offer is closed, you will be issued with a Unit Certificate. PLEASE NOTE - Your Unit Certificate will be uploaded to your investor portal approximately 4-6 weeks AFTER the close of the Offer. You will be emailed to advise once it has been uploaded.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
It's at this stage you will see your investment on your Investor Dashboard, under 'My Portfolio' and as a Current Investment, instead of Pending. Your receipt, share certificate and investment contract will all be under 'Files'. This is also where you will find your Investor Updates when issued.

The company has not met its "minimum subscription amount"

Once the offer closes and the company has not met its minimum subscription amount, the CSF offer will not be successful, all investment applications will be cancelled and all application money will be

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: What happens after I have invested?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: What happens after I have invested?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value: Investment opportunities with an associated monthly distribution attached to the investment terms will be paid monthly in arrears unless otherwise specified. i.e., distributions earned for January will be paid in February into the nominated bank account on record for your investment. Distributions will be paid by the 15th Business Day of the month that the payment will be paid.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: My investment has monthly distributions. When are they paid?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: My investment has monthly distributions. When are they paid?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value: The distribution rate is calculated daily on any of our investment products. Should an investment be placed during the month, the distribution rate is calculated pro-rata for the number of days the investment was held during the month. I.e., If an investment is undertaken on the 10th of March, the investment is only held for 21 days of the 31-day month. Thus the distributions will be paid for the actual time (number of days) your investment was held. As such, the distributions due for the 21 days are payable by the 15th business day in April (distributions are paid monthly in arrears).

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: Why are the distributions paid to my account, not for an entire month?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: Why are the distributions paid to my account, not for an entire month?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
It is free to register to our VentureCrowd platform.

Contribution Fee

When you invest, a 1.1% contribution fee applies. This fee helps cover the costs of establishing a trust for each company or project (especially in property developments) to act as a nominee under our nominee structure.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Performance Fee

We charge a performance fee only upon a successful exit. For instance, if you invest $1,000 in Company XYZ, and your investment grows to $2,000 at exit, you’ll receive $1,800 after the 20% performance fee on the $1,000 profit is deducted.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: What are the fees for investing on VentureCrowd?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: What are the fees for investing on VentureCrowd?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Via Trust

If you have invested through a VentureCrowd Trust, you do not own any securities directly in the company. Instead, you hold units in the VentureCrowd Trust that has invested in the company on your behalf.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Via CSF offer

If you were part of a Crowd-Sourced Funding (CSF), raise, you own shares in the company directly, which is reflected on your share certificate.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: What percentage of ownership do I have in the company I have invested in?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_1_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: What percentage of ownership do I have in the company I have invested in?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value: The investment you hold through VentureCrowd, through a trust, is in privately held company/ies. A Privately held company has not undergone a formal listing and as such, it is not available in the open and listed market.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: Why is my investment not reflecting on an listed exchange like the ASX?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_2_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: Why is my investment not reflecting on an listed exchange like the ASX?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value: The market in which Founders and their start-up business operates in are dynamic and constantly evolving. Dependent on prevailing market conditions and larger macro economic changes, the founder’s of the company that your investment is held may have to amend their original forecasted exit in terms of timeframes originally provided as well as the type of exit strategy that will need to be implemented.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value: The original investment value is not guaranteed, nor is the forecasted future growth value and is dependent on the success of the company and its future strategies. VentureCrowd, as Trustee for the Trust, has no sway or influence on the outcome of your investment and its final financial position. It is important to note that the change in timeframes for an exit/liquidity event being extended beyond the initially forecasted timeframe does not automatically indicate financial trouble or turmoil for that company. VentureCrowd, as Trustee for the Trust, will keep you updated with our information rights requests from the business.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: Why has the Company I invested in yet to be listed?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_3_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: Why has the Company I invested in yet to be listed?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Column_1
componentInstanceProperties.value:
As a private company, no off-market transfers are available on this investment, so this holding/investment should be considered illiquid.  The value of your investment can only be realised at exit or payout when the company is sold or implements an exit strategy.  VentureCrowd does not provide a secondary market to our investors that facilitates the trade of your investments.

VentureCrowd cannot provide a secondary market for your investment should you wish to disinvest your holding/s before an exit has been realized.  We can only facilitate a transfer of ownership - the administration component of the sale of your holding to another investor.  The sourcing of an alternate investor and the financial agreement of any transactions or financial undertakings will need to be handled directly by you as the investor.

This investment value is not guaranteed in the future and is dependent on the success of The Founding Company and its future strategies.  VentureCrowd, as Trustee for the Trust, has no sway or influence on the outcome of your investment and its final financial position.    Any profits or losses will be reflected on the annual tax statement for the corresponding financial year, and these can be used in your annual tax return.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Column_2
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Liquidity events are forecasted with a likely timeframe by the company founders in which you are an investor.  The projected exit and timeframes do not occur in a static environment, and the company's original forecasts and/or strategies may need to be changed or extended due to factors beyond the prediction or control of the founding company.

Your investment can only be exited, and any financial outcome is realised when a liquidity event is created, allowing for disinvestment.  The possible liquidity events that may take place are:
  • The Founding Company is bought out/sold to another business, at which point the share price is determined and documented in the transaction.  A component of this agreement may allow for current investors to be redeemed/exited/paid out.  This is deal and company-specific and can not be determined at the investment stage.

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Header
componentInstanceProperties.value: How do I exit/get my money back from my VentureCrowd investment in a Company?

componentInstanceProperties.name: label_Tab_4_Name
componentInstanceProperties.value: How do I exit/get my money back from my VentureCrowd investment in a Company?
